definition: The date the digital object was last updated. Must conform to the ISO 8601 standard.
The procedure, technique, or mode of inquiry used to attain data. Also referred to as "Data Capture Method".
Description of the data collection method.
example: Coordinate acquired by field staff using real-time corrected GPS

definition: Numeric value for the accuracy in meters.
Method for determining accuracy of the data.
example: The majority of outfalls were heads-up digitized from USGS 7.5" DRGs. Coordinates were measured by heads-up digitizing from DRGs are considered to be accurate to about 12 meters (National Map Accuracy Standards for 1:24K).

definition: Numeric value for the accuracy in meters.
Method for determining accuracy of the data.
example: Vertical elevations based on contours and benchmarks on USGS Topos.

definition: A vertical datum is a surface of zero elevation to which heights of various points are referenced.
